com.storytron.swat.util

Class UndoableSlider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.storytron.swat.util.UndoableSlider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

    public abstract class UndoableSlider
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, java.lang.Cloneable
    This is a class for undoing slider actions. Changes done in intervals smaller than 750 ms are merged into a single undo & redo action.

    The UndoableSlider registers as a ChangeListener of a slider. Whenever the slider is changed, proper UndoableActions are registered with the UndoManager.

    This class uses Object.clone() to make independent undoable actions. So, if you subclass this class you may like to deepcopy any of its fields.

    Here's an example: 

                    new UndoableSlider(swat,sliderForATraitValue){
                        Actor actor;

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UndoableSlider(Swat swat, Swat.Slider sld)
      Creates a SliderUndo which registers on swat UndoableActions generated by the slider sld.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public abstract int init()
        This is called every time the slider is changed.

      • setValue

        public abstract void setValue(int value)
        This is called for setting a value on the model. It is also called after init() when the slider changes. You don't need to set back the slider state, that's done automatically for you.

      • undoRedoExecuted

        public abstract void undoRedoExecuted()
        This is called to update the GUI after a redo or undo. You don't need to set back the slider state, that's done automatically for you.

      • getPresentationName

        public java.lang.String getPresentationName()
        Override this if you want to set a name for the generated actions. This is called whenever an undoable action is generated.

      • stateChanged

        public void stateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent e)
        Specified by:
        stateChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
